                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Peggy Zhao

                                                                                                                                        Peggy Zhao

                                                                                                                                        Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 11:52am
                                                                                                                                        Hi, Destiny! For your first question, I think you can cooperate with some companies whose business are about digital map or GPS. The track of locals' trajectories may be a good way to show the worth-visiting place.
                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                        • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                        Hi, Destiny!

                                                                                                                                        For your first question, I think you can cooperate with some companies whose business are about digital map or GPS. The track of locals' trajectories may be a good way to show the worth-visiting place.

                                                                                                                                        Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                        HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                          Attach
                                                                                                                                          Cancel
                                                                                                                                        • Collapse Subdiscussion Manuel Gonzalez

                                                                                                                                          Manuel Gonzalez

                                                                                                                                          Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:43am
                                                                                                                                          In my team’s project, the “how might we?” question that we are focusing on is somewhere along the lines of, how might we create a place where students are given the creative freedom to anonymously voice any kind of statements they want to make?  The core elements of this project lie around the basic concepts of creativity, anonymity, and the systems in place at a university like this that prevent that kind of discourse from being as prevalent as it could be. To answer our question we need to better define anonymity and develop a space with that in mind. Additionally, we need to ask ourselves how we can maintain that same level of privacy in a public space. Another element is open discourse. The idea of saying what you want to say or what needs to be said while engaging in open discussions with others surrounding these topics. Our university as a setting for this is in itself an element since college embodies free thinking and the exploration of ideas.   Why is it that certain discourse is only appropriate to be said in private spaces? Especially at a place like college that is supposed to nurture discourse from any angle How can a place be branded as anonymous and still maintain that anonymity?
                                                                                                                                          Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                          • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                          • Edit
                                                                                                                                          • Delete
                                                                                                                                          • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                          In my team’s project, the “how might we?” question that we are focusing on is somewhere along the lines of, how might we create a place where students are given the creative freedom to anonymously voice any kind of statements they want to make?  The core elements of this project lie around the basic concepts of creativity, anonymity, and the systems in place at a university like this that prevent that kind of discourse from being as prevalent as it could be. To answer our question we need to better define anonymity and develop a space with that in mind. Additionally, we need to ask ourselves how we can maintain that same level of privacy in a public space. Another element is open discourse. The idea of saying what you want to say or what needs to be said while engaging in open discussions with others surrounding these topics. Our university as a setting for this is in itself an element since college embodies free thinking and the exploration of ideas.

                                                                                                                                           

                                                                                                                                          1. Why is it that certain discourse is only appropriate to be said in private spaces? Especially at a place like college that is supposed to nurture discourse from any angle
                                                                                                                                          2. How can a place be branded as anonymous and still maintain that anonymity?
                                                                                                                                          Edited by Manuel Gonzalez on Mar 14 at 12:50am
                                                                                                                                          Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                          HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                            Attach
                                                                                                                                            Cancel
                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion Samantha Holder

                                                                                                                                              Samantha Holder

                                                                                                                                              Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:49am
                                                                                                                                              How Might We: create a classroom tool (i.e. program, workshop, book, etc.) that emphasizes the value of education and increases educational equity.   Our question lies within the education system which is in turn heavily impacted by the political system. The core elements reflect the various levels of influence from the Department of Education, to state government (and how much funding they give schools), to local school board and district superintendents, to individual school principals and teachers. Each level impact educational equity in varying degrees and magnitude. After reviewing some of the solutions in the education space that currently exist, I became overwhelmed by the complexity of our problem and the education system at large. While this complex system is intimidating, the Simplifying Complexity video has helped me realize how a holistic approach to the problem can actually help find simple solutions. I assumed that due to the complexity, our group would hone in on a super specific aspect of education inequity (which we probably will eventually), but even in my brainstorming, I was forgetting to include that aspect in the greater context of education and educational inequity as a whole. Beyond economic and educational policy, another core element of the education system is the student-student, student-teacher, and student-parent interactions that inhabit it. The system also exists in different levels, ranging from primary school to college. Inequity manifests at each of these levels differently, leading to the need for varying solutions at each level and a desire to find the root of the inequities.   Is it possible to create a tool that helps fight educational inequity at all levels of education, or should our solution focus on a specific school time period? To what extent are teachers currently promoting or preventing education inequity through actions that disagree with their district’s official policy?
                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                              • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                              • Edit
                                                                                                                                              • Delete
                                                                                                                                              • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                              How Might We: create a classroom tool (i.e. program, workshop, book, etc.) that emphasizes the value of education and increases educational equity.

                                                                                                                                               

                                                                                                                                              Our question lies within the education system which is in turn heavily impacted by the political system. The core elements reflect the various levels of influence from the Department of Education, to state government (and how much funding they give schools), to local school board and district superintendents, to individual school principals and teachers. Each level impact educational equity in varying degrees and magnitude. After reviewing some of the solutions in the education space that currently exist, I became overwhelmed by the complexity of our problem and the education system at large. While this complex system is intimidating, the Simplifying Complexity video has helped me realize how a holistic approach to the problem can actually help find simple solutions. I assumed that due to the complexity, our group would hone in on a super specific aspect of education inequity (which we probably will eventually), but even in my brainstorming, I was forgetting to include that aspect in the greater context of education and educational inequity as a whole. Beyond economic and educational policy, another core element of the education system is the student-student, student-teacher, and student-parent interactions that inhabit it. The system also exists in different levels, ranging from primary school to college. Inequity manifests at each of these levels differently, leading to the need for varying solutions at each level and a desire to find the root of the inequities.

                                                                                                                                               

                                                                                                                                              1. Is it possible to create a tool that helps fight educational inequity at all levels of education, or should our solution focus on a specific school time period?
                                                                                                                                              2. To what extent are teachers currently promoting or preventing education inequity through actions that disagree with their district’s official policy?
                                                                                                                                              Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                              HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                Attach
                                                                                                                                                Cancel
                                                                                                                                                • Collapse Subdiscussion Kathleen Masancay

                                                                                                                                                  Kathleen Masancay

                                                                                                                                                  Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 2:38am
                                                                                                                                                  My team and I are working around ideas and solutions regarding the normalization of an individual's alone-ness in obviously social situations. We want to work towards creating a project that's part product, part socially engaged art that can really engage with the individual's sense of comfort in being alone in explicitly social situations such as parties, movies, concerts, music festivals, and even just eating out alone in restaurants or bars.   Some key concepts/elements that we're looking at are: reducing social anxiety, possibility of connecting with others (but not in anyway like Tinder), normalization of solitude (it doesn't have to be a bad thing!).  Two questions I'd like to ask are: What's your opinion on individuals around our age who attend music festivals alone? What kind of social pressures do you feel whenever you're at a party?
                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                  • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                  • Edit
                                                                                                                                                  • Delete
                                                                                                                                                  • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                  My team and I are working around ideas and solutions regarding the normalization of an individual's alone-ness in obviously social situations. We want to work towards creating a project that's part product, part socially engaged art that can really engage with the individual's sense of comfort in being alone in explicitly social situations such as parties, movies, concerts, music festivals, and even just eating out alone in restaurants or bars.  

                                                                                                                                                  Some key concepts/elements that we're looking at are: reducing social anxiety, possibility of connecting with others (but not in anyway like Tinder), normalization of solitude (it doesn't have to be a bad thing!). 

                                                                                                                                                  Two questions I'd like to ask are: What's your opinion on individuals around our age who attend music festivals alone? What kind of social pressures do you feel whenever you're at a party?

                                                                                                                                                  Edited by Kathleen Masancay on Mar 14 at 2:47am

                                                                                                                                                    • Collapse Subdiscussion Molly Simon

                                                                                                                                                      Molly Simon

                                                                                                                                                      Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 1:36pm
                                                                                                                                                      Hi Kathleen, first off I want to say--really cool project idea, im definitely curious where you guys take this! In response to your questions: I find that often times it is seen as more strange or "risky" or stigmatized in other ways when FEMALES especially attend functions alone. For some reason, I feel as though it is less strange to see men alone in public settings--less questioned at least. Then again, definitely depends on the social context.  When I am at a party, I often feel the pressure to make small-talk with people I am around. Often times this becomes boring and really anxiety-provoking!

For some reason, I feel as though it is less strange to see men alone in public settings--less questioned at least. Then again, definitely depends on the social context. 


                                                                                                                                                      When I am at a party, I often feel the pressure to make small-talk with people I am around. Often times this becomes boring and really anxiety-provoking!

                                                                                                                                                          Manuel Gonzalez

                                                                                                                                                          Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 1:42pm
                                                                                                                                                          Hey Kathleen, to answer your question, I've gone to many concerts by myself, not the same as music festivals, but similar on the sense that there's usually pressure to go with someone else instead of by yourself. In regards to festivals, I think the biggest part of that is social interaction. It's all about the kind of mindset you have going on and whether you like being part of something bigger and engaging with others or prefer to stay in the back seat and enjoy yourself. I think there is alot of pressure during parties to in some way contribute to the overall atmosphere, I don't like parties and a lot of that has to do with the social pressure of interactions

In regards to festivals, I think the biggest part of that is social interaction. It's all about the kind of mindset you have going on and whether you like being part of something bigger and engaging with others or prefer to stay in the back seat and enjoy yourself. I think there is alot of pressure during parties to in some way contribute to the overall atmosphere, I don't like parties and a lot of that has to do with the social pressure of interactions

                                                                                                                                                                Lal Altuner

                                                                                                                                                                Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 2:27pm
                                                                                                                                                                Hi Kathleen, I really liked your question. I have the same problem in my life. ı like to eat alone or listen music, but if I do that some people look like I am a lonely person or I don't have friends, but it's not like that! Sometimes you just want to be alone, it doesn't mean that you are lonely. As an answer to your question, I really support attending to festivals alone. You can meet a lot of people there or enjoy the music yourself. To answer your second question, I should say that people are generally in groups during a party. As a social pressure, I feel like you have to drink and have fun all the time which can be stressing if you are not in that mood.

                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Inaara Charolia

                                                                                                                                                                        Inaara Charolia

                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 5:16pm
                                                                                                                                                                        Hey Kathleen,  I  find the question your group is tackling to be really interesting. It actually reminds me of an article I read where they talked about coffee shops and how many tables were switched from square shaped ones to circular ones. This was because, through observational studies, square shaped tables made the customers that came alone feel awkward as they felt they were obligated to have to have another person sit with them when they used square/rectangular tables. I really found this to be interesting how objects and the way spaces are designed can influence customer behavior. Though I don't necessarily find anything particularly strange about going to a concert or party alone, hopefully this gives you inspiration for your work to reduce the social anxieties many of us are familiar with.
                                                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                        Hey Kathleen, 

                                                                                                                                                                        I  find the question your group is tackling to be really interesting. It actually reminds me of an article I read where they talked about coffee shops and how many tables were switched from square shaped ones to circular ones. This was because, through observational studies, square shaped tables made the customers that came alone feel awkward as they felt they were obligated to have to have another person sit with them when they used square/rectangular tables. I really found this to be interesting how objects and the way spaces are designed can influence customer behavior. Though I don't necessarily find anything particularly strange about going to a concert or party alone, hopefully this gives you inspiration for your work to reduce the social anxieties many of us are familiar with.

                                                                                                                                                                          • Collapse Subdiscussion Stephanie Luna-Lopez

                                                                                                                                                                            Stephanie Luna-Lopez

                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 8:23pm
                                                                                                                                                                            Hey Kathleen! I can sympathize with people that go to social events alone because sometimes my friends aren't into the same stuff as I, and I find myself not going at all because I don't feel comfortable going alone. I think this could be a great way to empower people to not restrict themselves from going out and creating a sense of independence. I personally don't see anything wrong with attending music festivals or parties alone because that gives you more reason to interact with people that you may have not talked to if you would have gone with friends. I agree that there are social pressures at parties to be a part of a group and socialize, or simply to feel safe in such an environment. A party is much more enjoyable when you are having fun with friends, and safer if you are drinking to have someone looking out for you or vice versa. I'm not sure what could be used to fix this problem, but it would definitely be beneficial to people who are anti social as well. Best of luck!
                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                            Hey Kathleen!

                                                                                                                                                                            I can sympathize with people that go to social events alone because sometimes my friends aren't into the same stuff as I, and I find myself not going at all because I don't feel comfortable going alone. I think this could be a great way to empower people to not restrict themselves from going out and creating a sense of independence. I personally don't see anything wrong with attending music festivals or parties alone because that gives you more reason to interact with people that you may have not talked to if you would have gone with friends. I agree that there are social pressures at parties to be a part of a group and socialize, or simply to feel safe in such an environment. A party is much more enjoyable when you are having fun with friends, and safer if you are drinking to have someone looking out for you or vice versa. I'm not sure what could be used to fix this problem, but it would definitely be beneficial to people who are anti social as well. Best of luck!

                                                                                                                                                                              • Collapse Subdiscussion Angela Colback

                                                                                                                                                                                Angela Colback

                                                                                                                                                                                Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 11:36pm
                                                                                                                                                                                Hi Kathleen!  This is such an interesting topic that you are working on. I also wonder how being alone is typically so stigmatized. I remember freshmen year when I would be so scared and anxious at the thought of having to eat alone. I would always, always try to find someone to eat with just so I would not have to sit by myself. Now, as a senior, I do not fear eating alone and at times when I have to eat on campus between classes, I enjoy sitting on memorial glade, alone with my thoughts, taking time to reflect. Taking this time to myself brings a sense of self awareness and calmness. To be able to translate this to a social setting, i.e. parties, bars, would be such an interesting experience and project. In my opinion, individuals that attend music festivals alone are the individuals that are heavily invested in the music rather than the social aspect of music festivals. I feel like this speaks to their level of commitment with the music and may even reflect on their devotion to the music. In a party-like setting, I never find myself alone only because I always make sure friends are going to be there, or I'll meet up with friends beforehand and we'll go together. But maybe that's because these types of situations, for me, are for the purpose of interacting with friends and other people in general.  
                                                                                                                                                                                Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                Hi Kathleen! 

                                                                                                                                                                                This is such an interesting topic that you are working on. I also wonder how being alone is typically so stigmatized. I remember freshmen year when I would be so scared and anxious at the thought of having to eat alone. I would always, always try to find someone to eat with just so I would not have to sit by myself. Now, as a senior, I do not fear eating alone and at times when I have to eat on campus between classes, I enjoy sitting on memorial glade, alone with my thoughts, taking time to reflect. Taking this time to myself brings a sense of self awareness and calmness. To be able to translate this to a social setting, i.e. parties, bars, would be such an interesting experience and project.

                                                                                                                                                                                In my opinion, individuals that attend music festivals alone are the individuals that are heavily invested in the music rather than the social aspect of music festivals. I feel like this speaks to their level of commitment with the music and may even reflect on their devotion to the music. In a party-like setting, I never find myself alone only because I always make sure friends are going to be there, or I'll meet up with friends beforehand and we'll go together. But maybe that's because these types of situations, for me, are for the purpose of interacting with friends and other people in general.

I usually respect people who can do things by themselves! The social pressures that I feel when I'm at a party are to be with my friends or people I know, and look like I'm having fun! I feel like I need to be occupied doing something or talking to someone.

I usually respect people who can do things by themselves!

                                                                                                                                                                                    The social pressures that I feel when I'm at a party are to be with my friends or people I know, and look like I'm having fun! I feel like I need to be occupied doing something or talking to someone.

                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Arvin Villadelgado

                                                                                                                                                                                        Arvin Villadelgado

                                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 12:05pm
                                                                                                                                                                                        As a freshman, I remember in the beginning of the semester when there were events to help first years meet new people. I just remember meeting a bunch of people while forcing myself to do small talk and repeating this process over and over and I never really stayed in touch with anyone I met. I felt like I had to interact with people, rather than make new meaningful friends.    I think it may be strange to see people attend a music festival alone. Mainly because many of my friends who attend these events typically go with other friends. I think that is where a lot of the fun comes from too. If there's a decent lineup of artists (nothing too big but nothing too unknown) but all of your friends are going, then the experience will usually be much better.

                                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                        As a freshman, I remember in the beginning of the semester when there were events to help first years meet new people. I just remember meeting a bunch of people while forcing myself to do small talk and repeating this process over and over and I never really stayed in touch with anyone I met. I felt like I had to interact with people, rather than make new meaningful friends. 

                                                                                                                                                                                         

                                                                                                                                                                                        I think it may be strange to see people attend a music festival alone. Mainly because many of my friends who attend these events typically go with other friends. I think that is where a lot of the fun comes from too. If there's a decent lineup of artists (nothing too big but nothing too unknown) but all of your friends are going, then the experience will usually be much better.

                                                                                                                                                                                          • Collapse Subdiscussion Samantha Lamos

                                                                                                                                                                                            Samantha Lamos

                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 2:34pm
                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Kathleen,  Thank you for your post, I believe that there is definitely a social pressure to not go out alone, whether that be because people do not have the tendency to meet new people or a safety issue. Although I fully believe that spending time alone is healthy and necessary for a good amount of self confidence, I think that going out to a party for example is most enjoyed with friends but  that is just my opinion. Regardless, I think that when people feel that they need to be with others in order to feel comfortable it comes down to a lack of  self confidence.

                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Parent

                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Kathleen, 

                                                                                                                                                                                            Thank you for your post, I believe that there is definitely a social pressure to not go out alone, whether that be because people do not have the tendency to meet new people or a safety issue. Although I fully believe that spending time alone is healthy and necessary for a good amount of self confidence, I think that going out to a party for example is most enjoyed with friends but  that is just my opinion. Regardless, I think that when people feel that they need to be with others in order to feel comfortable it comes down to a lack of  self confidence.

                                                                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion Rachel Hokanson

                                                                                                                                                                                              Rachel Hokanson

                                                                                                                                                                                              Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 8:14am
                                                                                                                                                                                              How might we connect successful people in different career paths to those seeking guidance? I think one of the core elements is developing empathy. Putting ourselves in the customer or users shoes will allow us to better cater to their needs. By developing empathy our group can see what types of platforms users want or would be the best. Another core element that sits around our question is learning through experimentation. I feel that the more we experiment with different ways of having our question, the better we will find a successful way. Though the problem with experimentation is that many of them take time to do and get fast data, so the ones we would test would need to be fast. I don't fully grasp the concept of complexity mapping and how that can be applied to different things, in our group's question for instance, how could we utilize complexity mapping for our benefit? Another question I have is how might we continue to frame we reframe when we seem to be exhausted of ideas?
                                                                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                              • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                              • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                              • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                              • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                              How might we connect successful people in different career paths to those seeking guidance?

                                                                                                                                                                                              I think one of the core elements is developing empathy. Putting ourselves in the customer or users shoes will allow us to better cater to their needs. By developing empathy our group can see what types of platforms users want or would be the best.

                                                                                                                                                                                              Another core element that sits around our question is learning through experimentation. I feel that the more we experiment with different ways of having our question, the better we will find a successful way. Though the problem with experimentation is that many of them take time to do and get fast data, so the ones we would test would need to be fast.

                                                                                                                                                                                              I don't fully grasp the concept of complexity mapping and how that can be applied to different things, in our group's question for instance, how could we utilize complexity mapping for our benefit?

                                                                                                                                                                                              Another question I have is how might we continue to frame we reframe when we seem to be exhausted of ideas?

                                                                                                                                                                                              Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                              HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                • Collapse Subdiscussion Aramis Anderson

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Aramis Anderson

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:17pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                  Brainstorming can be exhausting after awhile one thing is to take a stepback and catch a breather. Next, if you can't add on,assess the plausibility of the ideas that you already have. Lookup SWOT Analysis. Lastly, ask people around you about the concept and the field you are looking into. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Brainstorming can be exhausting after awhile one thing is to take a stepback and catch a breather. Next, if you can't add on,assess the plausibility of the ideas that you already have. Lookup SWOT Analysis. Lastly, ask people around you about the concept and the field you are looking into.

                                                                                                                                                                                                    Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Collapse Subdiscussion Priyanka Saiprasad

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Priyanka Saiprasad

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:59pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Rachel! Connecting successful people in different career paths to those seeking guidance is a great question since people are always in need of advice especially during job searching. For the first question the complexity mapping can be applied to different things for your groups benefit. For example one of the biggest issue that was addressed was communication and how to look at bigger pictures instead of focusing on the small details an trying to solve all of them at once. Take things one step at a time. Next, framing and reframing is tedious and does not have to rely on one person's ideas but the groups, and how those ideas evolve with time.

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Rachel!

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Connecting successful people in different career paths to those seeking guidance is a great question since people are always in need of advice especially during job searching. For the first question the complexity mapping can be applied to different things for your groups benefit. For example one of the biggest issue that was addressed was communication and how to look at bigger pictures instead of focusing on the small details an trying to solve all of them at once. Take things one step at a time. Next, framing and reframing is tedious and does not have to rely on one person's ideas but the groups, and how those ideas evolve with time.

                                                                                                                                                                                                          Inaara Charolia

                                                                                                                                                                                                          Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 5:26pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                          Hey Rachel,  I definitely like the question you pose, as it is something we were all proposed at the beginning of the course. I also had a similar question about the complexity mapping, as I did find it a little confusing (maybe because the video was too short for him to really go into detail). However, I do have some thoughts on your second question. I think the best way, as our professors in this class have suggested, to frame and reframe is to talk to new people and pose interesting questions to them. Hearing from other people is honestly the best way I (and I'm sure countless others) can get inspired for new ideas or ways of looking at things. Really enjoyed your post!

                                                                                                                                                                                                          Hey Rachel, 

                                                                                                                                                                                                          I definitely like the question you pose, as it is something we were all proposed at the beginning of the course. I also had a similar question about the complexity mapping, as I did find it a little confusing (maybe because the video was too short for him to really go into detail). However, I do have some thoughts on your second question. I think the best way, as our professors in this class have suggested, to frame and reframe is to talk to new people and pose interesting questions to them. Hearing from other people is honestly the best way I (and I'm sure countless others) can get inspired for new ideas or ways of looking at things. Really enjoyed your post!

                                                                                                                                                                                                            Aramis Anderson

                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:12pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                            My team's how might we is "how might we help individuals to express themselves through accessible, high quality, sustainable and affordable unique clothing?" I would have to say that the core elements of the system that sits around this how might we, would have to be finding sustainable, eco friendly and recycled source of I brake for the clothing, getting these different forms of art expression made real, keeping up with trends, and remain a sustainable as possible.   What would be a good way to explore ideas for artistic concepts and keeping it diversified to consumer needs/wants? How to keep up with current trends if constantly in the process of reuse of old frabrics and clothes?
                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                            My team's how might we is "how might we help individuals to express themselves through accessible, high quality, sustainable and affordable unique clothing?"

                                                                                                                                                                                                            I would have to say that the core elements of the system that sits around this how might we, would have to be finding sustainable, eco friendly and recycled source of I brake for the clothing, getting these different forms of art expression made real, keeping up with trends, and remain a sustainable as possible.

                                                                                                                                                                                                             

                                                                                                                                                                                                            What would be a good way to explore ideas for artistic concepts and keeping it diversified to consumer needs/wants?


                                                                                                                                                                                                            How to keep up with current trends if constantly in the process of reuse of old frabrics and clothes?

                                                                                                                                                                                                            Edited by Aramis Anderson on Mar 14 at 12:19pm

                                                                                                                                                                                                                Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:44pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                Hey Aramis! To answer your second question, I think in some sense people actually enjoy reusing old fabrics and clothes because it makes them feel good about contributing to the environment (at least I do at least). Maybe an idea would be to combine that concept with thrifting? That seems to be a big trend these days.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                Hey Aramis!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                To answer your second question, I think in some sense people actually enjoy reusing old fabrics and clothes because it makes them feel good about contributing to the environment (at least I do at least). Maybe an idea would be to combine that concept with thrifting? That seems to be a big trend these days.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Priyanka Saiprasad

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Priyanka Saiprasad

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:56pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Hey Aramis! I think that clothing is very personal and unique and it is great that your team is trying to individualize that experience. Some good ways to explore ideas for artistic concepts would be to incorporate modern elements of graphic design and maybe do some polls or research on contemporary fabrics or design clothing, even looking at some runway clothing, depending on your target audience. For the second question try to find a way that old clothes can be repurposed into the creation of new clothing, maybe some of the fabrics can be repurposed or the dye from old clothes can be used to create a print design on the new clothes. Try to play around with the concept of repurposing material and incorporating current trends.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Hey Aramis!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I think that clothing is very personal and unique and it is great that your team is trying to individualize that experience. Some good ways to explore ideas for artistic concepts would be to incorporate modern elements of graphic design and maybe do some polls or research on contemporary fabrics or design clothing, even looking at some runway clothing, depending on your target audience. For the second question try to find a way that old clothes can be repurposed into the creation of new clothing, maybe some of the fabrics can be repurposed or the dye from old clothes can be used to create a print design on the new clothes. Try to play around with the concept of repurposing material and incorporating current trends.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Collapse Subdiscussion Sharon Wang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Sharon Wang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:42pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Our team is focusing on the problem of shyness and the way it is perceived by others. We don't have a specific "how might we" question yet because the subject of shyness in itself is very broad. However, we each have personal "how might we" questions which include "how might we make being alone a good thing?" or "how might we make something to get people to engage with each other?". Our goal for now is to somehow integrate all of these into a project goal.  After reading the "Framing and Reframing" Article, I realized that our situation is similar to the problem that the microphone company Shure encountered- artists did not want to use hearing aids because they would be labeled as damaged or old people. For us, I think that people do not want to fix the perception of shyness because they already see it as something negative. Shure was able to fix its problem by transforming the hearing aid into an in-ear monitor which ended up being really popular among its users. Some questions I have are 1) What are ways in which our team could narrow down our "how might we" question? and 2) How do we prevent over-complicating our "how might we" question?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Our team is focusing on the problem of shyness and the way it is perceived by others. We don't have a specific "how might we" question yet because the subject of shyness in itself is very broad. However, we each have personal "how might we" questions which include "how might we make being alone a good thing?" or "how might we make something to get people to engage with each other?". Our goal for now is to somehow integrate all of these into a project goal. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      After reading the "Framing and Reframing" Article, I realized that our situation is similar to the problem that the microphone company Shure encountered- artists did not want to use hearing aids because they would be labeled as damaged or old people. For us, I think that people do not want to fix the perception of shyness because they already see it as something negative. Shure was able to fix its problem by transforming the hearing aid into an in-ear monitor which ended up being really popular among its users.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Some questions I have are 1) What are ways in which our team could narrow down our "how might we" question? and 2) How do we prevent over-complicating our "how might we" question?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Andrew Huang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:51pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          How might we provide/facilitate/encourage safe spaces on UC Berkeley campus for creative expression? Some critical components of this HMW are legality (school property), nature of the space (privacy & accessibility),  and creative expression (why?/how?). Two questions about this system: What are some instances of creative expression around campus, and what is the intent/goal behind them? What is the role of privacy & accessibility in these instances?   Any comments would be much appreciated!
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          How might we provide/facilitate/encourage safe spaces on UC Berkeley campus for creative expression? Some critical components of this HMW are legality (school property), nature of the space (privacy & accessibility),  and creative expression (why?/how?).

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Two questions about this system:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          What are some instances of creative expression around campus, and what is the intent/goal behind them?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          What is the role of privacy & accessibility in these instances?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                           

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Any comments would be much appreciated!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Edited by Andrew Huang on Mar 14 at 12:52pm

And I think that singing is a creative expression in campus, like the A cappella perform around Sather Gater, which is solo singing without instrumental accompaniment. The goal behind it maybe to inspire student to use sing to express and feel more relax.

And I think that singing is a creative expression in campus, like the A cappella perform around Sather Gater, which is solo singing without instrumental accompaniment.
