                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Collapse Subdiscussion Priyanka Saiprasad

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Priyanka Saiprasad

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 12:52pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                For my group our mission statement including our how might we question was that our mission is to help create a platform for University of California Berkeley designers to grow, enabling them with a sense of belonging and identity. The core elements of our how might we question involve trying to create a platform space for fellow designers to collaborate and have an environment where they can discuss their innovations and share with fellow designers and art practice individuals to create a community of sorts. Our main goal is to provide designers with access to feel valued and have a sharing platform. In Eric’s Ted talk on Simplifying Complexity he shared that the simple power of good visualization tools involves helping to untangle complexity and just encourage people to ask questions that they did not think of before.  Once again this framework centers around the theme of communication and group work and that simplicity often lives on the other side of complexity, so people should focus on the simple details that matter most instead of zooming in very close to analyze every aspect of things. The article on framing and reframing is to frame and reframe problems in order to help solve a question. People must work with empathy, insight and sympathy while diverging there knowledge with others to learn. Lastly the Talking to Humans article discusses how success starts with understanding your customers. In our case, our customer is design students looking for platforms to share their work or ideas with other fellow design interested individuals.  The fundamental aspects are to guide people to find interview candidates, structure and conduct effective interviews and synthesize the learning in a concessive manner to see what was achieved. Hopefully my team can achieve creating a space for likeminded designers to collaborate, and if not we can at least learn from the process. To do this we must talk to people, gather data, research and carry out our process into a tangible real world product or service. How might we make a service more accessible to the public? What are some ways in which we can utilize research to the fullest? 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                For my group our mission statement including our how might we question was that our mission is to help create a platform for University of California Berkeley designers to grow, enabling them with a sense of belonging and identity. The core elements of our how might we question involve trying to create a platform space for fellow designers to collaborate and have an environment where they can discuss their innovations and share with fellow designers and art practice individuals to create a community of sorts. Our main goal is to provide designers with access to feel valued and have a sharing platform. In Eric’s Ted talk on Simplifying Complexity he shared that the simple power of good visualization tools involves helping to untangle complexity and just encourage people to ask questions that they did not think of before. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Once again this framework centers around the theme of communication and group work and that simplicity often lives on the other side of complexity, so people should focus on the simple details that matter most instead of zooming in very close to analyze every aspect of things. The article on framing and reframing is to frame and reframe problems in order to help solve a question. People must work with empathy, insight and sympathy while diverging there knowledge with others to learn. Lastly the Talking to Humans article discusses how success starts with understanding your customers. In our case, our customer is design students looking for platforms to share their work or ideas with other fellow design interested individuals. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                The fundamental aspects are to guide people to find interview candidates, structure and conduct effective interviews and synthesize the learning in a concessive manner to see what was achieved. Hopefully my team can achieve creating a space for likeminded designers to collaborate, and if not we can at least learn from the process. To do this we must talk to people, gather data, research and carry out our process into a tangible real world product or service.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                How might we make a service more accessible to the public?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                What are some ways in which we can utilize research to the fullest? 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Edited by Priyanka Saiprasad on Mar 14 at 12:53pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Attach

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Molly Simon

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Molly Simon

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 1:31pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Hi Everyone! Our team is asking the question: "How might we offer more creative spaces on campus?" I think that what we are struggling with specificity in the framing of this question. Why do we need creative spaces? What is the response that we are trying to evoke? Is there a conversation we want to elicit? Who is our target audience? What is the scope of our space?  Definitely after doing the reading, I realized how we have a lot of questions that we need to address in trying to understand the NEEDS of students at Berkeley. Creativity is a tool that can be used to serve many different needs--I guess what we need to figure out, is what NEED in particular can creating more artistic interaction on campus address.  So my questions for my classmates are:  1. What does art/creative expression do for you? 2. How do you like to engage with art--through viewership or through creating yourself? 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Hi Everyone! Our team is asking the question: "How might we offer more creative spaces on campus?" I think that what we are struggling with specificity in the framing of this question. Why do we need creative spaces? What is the response that we are trying to evoke? Is there a conversation we want to elicit? Who is our target audience? What is the scope of our space? 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Definitely after doing the reading, I realized how we have a lot of questions that we need to address in trying to understand the NEEDS of students at Berkeley. Creativity is a tool that can be used to serve many different needs--I guess what we need to figure out, is what NEED in particular can creating more artistic interaction on campus address. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    So my questions for my classmates are: 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    1. What does art/creative expression do for you?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    2. How do you like to engage with art--through viewership or through creating yourself? 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Edited by Molly Simon on Mar 14 at 1:31pm

I engage with art everyday even if it is only in little quantities. I wish there were more outlets to practice art!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Akemi Levine

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 8:51pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Molly! I really like your how might we question! I think that our campus could really benefit from having more creative spaces available for students. I think art and creative expression are great methods for reliving stress and building community. Since Berkeley is known for its student body's poor mental health, I think more opportunities for art/creative expression would be a great initiative for the campus to take on. I personal like to engage in art as a spectator. I don't see myself as very artistic, but I can appreciate other people's skills. I love performances and galleries the best!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            I really like your how might we question! I think that our campus could really benefit from having more creative spaces available for students. I think art and creative expression are great methods for reliving stress and building community. Since Berkeley is known for its student body's poor mental health, I think more opportunities for art/creative expression would be a great initiative for the campus to take on. I personal like to engage in art as a spectator. I don't see myself as very artistic, but I can appreciate other people's skills. I love performances and galleries the best!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Catalina Biggerstaff

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 8:54am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Molly, I think this is an amazing concept that is in need on campus today. Creative expression has various meanings for me but as far as being on campus I think it's being able to be whoever I want, especially since the student body is so large you can walk around all day without seeing someone you know. My ideal creative space on campus would be somewhere I could relax that isn't a library but be able to work on project where there aren't desks and other conventional "study" elements.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Molly, I think this is an amazing concept that is in need on campus today. Creative expression has various meanings for me but as far as being on campus I think it's being able to be whoever I want, especially since the student body is so large you can walk around all day without seeing someone you know. My ideal creative space on campus would be somewhere I could relax that isn't a library but be able to work on project where there aren't desks and other conventional "study" elements.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Courtnie Chan

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Courtnie Chan

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 11:36am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Hi Molly,  Great job in taking a step back with your HMW and framing your questions for us around the reframe! I'd say creative expression allows for me to take a break. I prefer creating things myself and although I'm not an expert in anything like drawing, painting, sculpting, etc. I am definitely a person that needs a technical outlet and a creative outlet (but not too much of either at once). So, creative expression also allows for balance in my life.  Courtnie

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Collapse Subdiscussion Lauren Silver

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Lauren Silver

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 2:35pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            How might we allow individuals to express themselves through accessible, quality, sustainable, and affordable one of a kind clothing?   We arrived at this by imagining a way to create sustainable clothing to help with textile waste. We really wanted a cool clothing brand that incorporated environmental awareness.   Do you think textile waste is a big deal?   Do you think that donated clothing is recycled efficiently?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            How might we allow individuals to express themselves through accessible, quality, sustainable, and affordable one of a kind clothing?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            We arrived at this by imagining a way to create sustainable clothing to help with textile waste. We really wanted a cool clothing brand that incorporated environmental awareness.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Do you think textile waste is a big deal?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Do you think that donated clothing is recycled efficiently?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Collapse Subdiscussion Luke Zhang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Luke Zhang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 4:56pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Hi Lauren, I think most people don't really have an idea about the scope of textile waste. What could be useful is raising awareness for it and then having people decide if they want to participate in the cause. The same thing goes for donated clothing - if people know their donations are being completed, they might be more compelled to donate.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Hi Lauren,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                I think most people don't really have an idea about the scope of textile waste. What could be useful is raising awareness for it and then having people decide if they want to participate in the cause. The same thing goes for donated clothing - if people know their donations are being completed, they might be more compelled to donate.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Alyssa So

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Alyssa So

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 5:22pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Hi Lauren, Your team's question is super awesome!  Companies have been mass producing cheap clothes quickly to keep up with fashion trends (which means that they also fall apart easily), and so high quality and sustainable clothing are often overlooked in favor of accessibility, affordability and self-expression.   I definitely think textile waste is a huge deal, especially since tons of clothes are wasted each year and replaced by cheaply made clothing, which is a ridiculous use of our resources.  Most people end up throwing away clothes that they don't wear because they aren't aware of donation centers that are close to them, or don't want to go through the hassle of combing through their clothes to see what is worth donating.   I'm an extensive thrift shopper who buys and sells clothes, and one of the things that I especially see in places like Goodwill is the lack of care and concern in pricing the items, and donated clothing is definitely not recycled efficiently in this case.  Some items that should be given for free or re-purposed into other items are often priced incredibly high, whereas some other items that should be marked up are sold at cheap prices (which is less of an issue, but still is important to note).   I'm really interested to see where your team takes this project.  I'm wondering if your team would consider creating some "Buy it for life" items that would last a long time.  This would help with sustainability and quality of the clothing, but might not be as accessible or affordable.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Hi Lauren,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Your team's question is super awesome!  Companies have been mass producing cheap clothes quickly to keep up with fashion trends (which means that they also fall apart easily), and so high quality and sustainable clothing are often overlooked in favor of accessibility, affordability and self-expression.  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I definitely think textile waste is a huge deal, especially since tons of clothes are wasted each year and replaced by cheaply made clothing, which is a ridiculous use of our resources.  Most people end up throwing away clothes that they don't wear because they aren't aware of donation centers that are close to them, or don't want to go through the hassle of combing through their clothes to see what is worth donating.  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I'm an extensive thrift shopper who buys and sells clothes, and one of the things that I especially see in places like Goodwill is the lack of care and concern in pricing the items, and donated clothing is definitely not recycled efficiently in this case.  Some items that should be given for free or re-purposed into other items are often priced incredibly high, whereas some other items that should be marked up are sold at cheap prices (which is less of an issue, but still is important to note).  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I'm really interested to see where your team takes this project.  I'm wondering if your team would consider creating some "Buy it for life" items that would last a long time.  This would help with sustainability and quality of the clothing, but might not be as accessible or affordable.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Reply Reply to Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Honestly speaking, I'm not very aware about textile waste and the extent of textile waste. However, I do know that since fast fashion has become a huge thing in the recent years, the amount of textile waste has definitely increased. I doubt they are being recycled efficiently...

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Alexander Cassidy

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 8:16pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Your question on donated clothing was especially enlightening as it was coupled with an immediate realisation that I have no idea how this process actually happens at all. Having previously donated clothing or used local recycling facilities, I have always acted on the assumption that it is going toward a good cause.The only answer that I can give you is: I don't know. This means, however, that your topic is very interested and that awareness of this issue in particular is necessary.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Your question on donated clothing was especially enlightening as it was coupled with an immediate realisation that I have no idea how this process actually happens at all. Having previously donated clothing or used local recycling facilities, I have always acted on the assumption that it is going toward a good cause.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The only answer that I can give you is: I don't know. This means, however, that your topic is very interested and that awareness of this issue in particular is necessary.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion Carlos Allende Bres

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Carlos Allende Bres

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 5:54pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              How might we teach basic life skills and raise awareness to ensure independence? Around our HMW, we have a lot of stakeholders. For example, any kind of educational institution, its students and parents, professors, the administrations of those educational institutions. Each one of these have an immediate effect on our objective (HMW). As a secondary degree, we have the students' friends and close acquaintances, immediate relatives, people who interact with them every day.   How could we raise awareness? Demonstrate that these skills are essential for daily adult life? What could be the long-term effects on people that profit from others not knowing those skills? Say, electricians, mechanics, etc. Is it better to have independent citizens or promote the creation of those businesses?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              How might we teach basic life skills and raise awareness to ensure independence?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Around our HMW, we have a lot of stakeholders. For example, any kind of educational institution, its students and parents, professors, the administrations of those educational institutions. Each one of these have an immediate effect on our objective (HMW). As a secondary degree, we have the students' friends and close acquaintances, immediate relatives, people who interact with them every day.  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              1. How could we raise awareness? Demonstrate that these skills are essential for daily adult life?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              2. What could be the long-term effects on people that profit from others not knowing those skills? Say, electricians, mechanics, etc. Is it better to have independent citizens or promote the creation of those businesses?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Collapse Subdiscussion Akemi Levine

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Akemi Levine

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 8:46pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hi Carlos, Your group project sounds super interesting! I like the second question that you posed! It is interesting to think about the potential benefits that some people may gain from keeping knowledge about life skills from the general public. The first thing that I thought of was accountants. If we were all taught how to do our taxes, would we need to hire someone to do them for us? I think that it is a good idea for fully functioning citizens to be able to be self-sufficient, but I also don't think that would make a whole industry disappear. People who could afford it would still use services like accountants, mechanics, and electricians because their time is valuable, but having those skills could greatly benefit people who can't afford it. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hi Carlos,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Your group project sounds super interesting! I like the second question that you posed! It is interesting to think about the potential benefits that some people may gain from keeping knowledge about life skills from the general public. The first thing that I thought of was accountants. If we were all taught how to do our taxes, would we need to hire someone to do them for us? I think that it is a good idea for fully functioning citizens to be able to be self-sufficient, but I also don't think that would make a whole industry disappear. People who could afford it would still use services like accountants, mechanics, and electricians because their time is valuable, but having those skills could greatly benefit people who can't afford it. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Collapse Subdiscussion Alyssa So

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Alyssa So

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 5:37pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Carlos, Your group project is definitely something that I hope will be worked on more in the States!   For your second question, I feel like this is where the "master-apprentice" comes into play.  It would be wonderful if these "masters" would host workshops for individuals to come out and learn the basics about their craft.  But obviously, unless they take it further and study it as much as these masters have, they won't know everything there is to know about the craft.  Ultimately, this makes electricians and mechanics still necessary.  There's a distinction between basic life skills and having master-ship over that skill.  In fact, I feel like these masters would be sought out even more if individuals know the basics of the skill.   In terms of raising awareness, educational institutions are important, but it's even more important to start at a child's first source of information--their parents.  If there was a way for the parents to take classes on how to teach basic life skills, future generations would be well-equipped to tackle on these tasks independently.  For example, it would be awesome if my mom had kept me in the kitchen while she cooked from a young age and showed me how to make a certain traditional dish.  Or if my dad walked me through how to file my taxes. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Carlos,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Your group project is definitely something that I hope will be worked on more in the States!  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      For your second question, I feel like this is where the "master-apprentice" comes into play.  It would be wonderful if these "masters" would host workshops for individuals to come out and learn the basics about their craft.  But obviously, unless they take it further and study it as much as these masters have, they won't know everything there is to know about the craft.  Ultimately, this makes electricians and mechanics still necessary.  There's a distinction between basic life skills and having master-ship over that skill.  In fact, I feel like these masters would be sought out even more if individuals know the basics of the skill.  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      In terms of raising awareness, educational institutions are important, but it's even more important to start at a child's first source of information--their parents.  If there was a way for the parents to take classes on how to teach basic life skills, future generations would be well-equipped to tackle on these tasks independently.  For example, it would be awesome if my mom had kept me in the kitchen while she cooked from a young age and showed me how to make a certain traditional dish.  Or if my dad walked me through how to file my taxes. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Collapse Subdiscussion Dion Dong

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Dion Dong

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 8:39pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          I think it is true to a certain extent that in the long term, a small group of people who were summoned to help cure the problem of people not knowing how to do the basics might take an impact, however if we look at it from another way, this lack of knowledge is like a disease, rather then constantly feeding it medicine (hiring electricians, mechanics) the better way would inherently be to educate the public so they would not have to deal with this issue in the first place. In economical terms, these people are only hired because it is a way of minimizing the economic loss and greatly capitalising from this hole, therefore I wouldn't think that there are that many necessary long term effects.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          I think it is true to a certain extent that in the long term, a small group of people who were summoned to help cure the problem of people not knowing how to do the basics might take an impact, however if we look at it from another way, this lack of knowledge is like a disease, rather then constantly feeding it medicine (hiring electricians, mechanics) the better way would inherently be to educate the public so they would not have to deal with this issue in the first place. In economical terms, these people are only hired because it is a way of minimizing the economic loss and greatly capitalising from this hole, therefore I wouldn't think that there are that many necessary long term effects.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Reply Reply to Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion Shreya Chaganti

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Shreya Chaganti

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:39am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Hi Carlos, I think there are certain skills that everyone should have, like doing taxes or opening a bank account or finding an apartment or cooking simple things. It's interesting to think about the effects of teaching those skills on people who are professionals at those skills, but like the others who responded I don't think that those industries would disappear if people had basic knowledge themselves.  In terms of raising awareness, I think that many people know that these skills are essential, but by the time they find that out it's pretty late. If there was a way to introduce these skills in high school or earlier, that would be helpful.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Hi Carlos,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              I think there are certain skills that everyone should have, like doing taxes or opening a bank account or finding an apartment or cooking simple things. It's interesting to think about the effects of teaching those skills on people who are professionals at those skills, but like the others who responded I don't think that those industries would disappear if people had basic knowledge themselves. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              In terms of raising awareness, I think that many people know that these skills are essential, but by the time they find that out it's pretty late. If there was a way to introduce these skills in high school or earlier, that would be helpful.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Peter Phan

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 12pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hello Carlos,   I think you could raise awareness by approaching students in school who are transitioning to their adult life (juniors, seniors). You could hold workshops helping build specific skills like finances, taxes, etc.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hello Carlos,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  I think you could raise awareness by approaching students in school who are transitioning to their adult life (juniors, seniors). You could hold workshops helping build specific skills like finances, taxes, etc.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
