                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Nicola Phillips

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Nicola Phillips

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 8:15pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Our group’s how might we question is "How might we teach basic life skills to ensure independence and increase people’s awareness on this topic?” The excerpt from “Thinking in Systems” defines a system as “a set of things—people, cells, molecules, or whatever—interconnected in such a way that they produce their own pattern of behavior over time.” I think the core elements of our system would be the students, their parents, teachers/schools, and the larger working world. They are connected by what the students are taught, what the parents/teachers/schools teach, what the students will later contribute to the world. The purpose of our system is to maximize contributions by the students (in a viable way, given the resources we have from parents/teachers/schools). Our how might we question focuses in on one particular way to maximize contributions, which is by teaching students basic “common sense” life skills. Our more specific goal is to create independent, capable future generations. One question I’d have about our system is how we incorporate those who would perhaps not benefit from our approach (ex. displaced workers)? I also wonder how we divvy up responsibility between parents and teachers/schools in order to maximize potential?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader


                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Our group’s how might we question is "How might we teach basic life skills to ensure independence and increase people’s awareness on this topic?” The excerpt from “Thinking in Systems” defines a system as “a set of things—people, cells, molecules, or whatever—interconnected in such a way that they produce their own pattern of behavior over time.” I think the core elements of our system would be the students, their parents, teachers/schools, and the larger working world. They are connected by what the students are taught, what the parents/teachers/schools teach, what the students will later contribute to the world. The purpose of our system is to maximize contributions by the students (in a viable way, given the resources we have from parents/teachers/schools). Our how might we question focuses in on one particular way to maximize contributions, which is by teaching students basic “common sense” life skills. Our more specific goal is to create independent, capable future generations. One question I’d have about our system is how we incorporate those who would perhaps not benefit from our approach (ex. displaced workers)? I also wonder how we divvy up responsibility between parents and teachers/schools in order to maximize potential?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Edited by Nicola Phillips on Mar 14 at 8:16pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Luke Zhang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Luke Zhang

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 4:54pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Hi Nicola, Those are interesting questions you pose for a good topic. If you would like your system to incorporate more than just students, you should probably list who else you would like to help and figure out their pain points and needs. This way your system would have a broader scope. Your second question is also a difficult one, as many people have probably been considering it. I would contend that schools should place more emphasis on life skills because it is a place to learn. Parents don't always have the time and some choose to shelter their children, but schools have the resources to educate them.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Hi Nicola,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Those are interesting questions you pose for a good topic. If you would like your system to incorporate more than just students, you should probably list who else you would like to help and figure out their pain points and needs. This way your system would have a broader scope. Your second question is also a difficult one, as many people have probably been considering it. I would contend that schools should place more emphasis on life skills because it is a place to learn. Parents don't always have the time and some choose to shelter their children, but schools have the resources to educate them.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Collapse Subdiscussion Angela Colback

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Angela Colback

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 11:24pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Nicola! I love that your group is taking on this very important topic. I know that after leaving the safety of home I realized that I was not well equipped to deal with the real world in terms of basic skills, however I was quickly forced to learn out of necessity. Still, I would not know how to change a tire, although I have become better acclimated with electrical wiring and plumbing through my experience living in an apartment. With tax season coming up, I have absolutely no idea what goes into filing your taxes and what that a W-2, now that I have one, really is. I definitely look forward to hearing the solution you come up with. For your second question, I think it could be useful to learn these skills at school but the parents should make sure that the skills are actually put to use by allowing their child to take part in what the skill is meant for, e.g. fixing a tire. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Nicola!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            I love that your group is taking on this very important topic. I know that after leaving the safety of home I realized that I was not well equipped to deal with the real world in terms of basic skills, however I was quickly forced to learn out of necessity. Still, I would not know how to change a tire, although I have become better acclimated with electrical wiring and plumbing through my experience living in an apartment. With tax season coming up, I have absolutely no idea what goes into filing your taxes and what that a W-2, now that I have one, really is. I definitely look forward to hearing the solution you come up with. For your second question, I think it could be useful to learn these skills at school but the parents should make sure that the skills are actually put to use by allowing their child to take part in what the skill is meant for, e.g. fixing a tire. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Reply Reply to Comment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Collapse Subdiscussion ELVA CHEN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ELVA CHEN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:43am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Hi Nicola, Your questions are very interesting to think about! I wouldn't worry too much about the consequences of your approach now because you did not come up with a solution yet. Only when your solution can address to a significantly large audience, it can potentially cause societal and economic changes. However, it is a good point to think about because as societies advance, the workforce is constantly changing, and that can be a good thing and a bad thing depending on how you look at this matter. For your second question, I encourage you to think in your whole system and beyond parents and teachers/schools. For example, I learn some of the basic life skills by watching YouTube videos or even just Googling them. The system you are tackling with is the whole environment that people are interacting with. I am sure you can gather more information on that during your interviews!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Hi Nicola,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Your questions are very interesting to think about! I wouldn't worry too much about the consequences of your approach now because you did not come up with a solution yet. Only when your solution can address to a significantly large audience, it can potentially cause societal and economic changes. However, it is a good point to think about because as societies advance, the workforce is constantly changing, and that can be a good thing and a bad thing depending on how you look at this matter.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                For your second question, I encourage you to think in your whole system and beyond parents and teachers/schools. For example, I learn some of the basic life skills by watching YouTube videos or even just Googling them. The system you are tackling with is the whole environment that people are interacting with. I am sure you can gather more information on that during your interviews!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Collapse Subdiscussion Akemi Levine

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Akemi Levine

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mar 14, 2017 Mar 14 at 8:40pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  The how might we question that my team is focused on is: How might be create a classroom tool (i.e. program, workshop, book, etc.) that will help address problems of educational inequity while promoting the value of education in society? Since solving educational inequity, and issues of inequity in general, is a huge and complicated task, the idea of framing and reframing the problem is super beneficial. I like the way that the “Simplifying Complexity” video put it: we must step back and acknowledge complexity so that you can hone into a specific problem that might end up being different than what you started with!   Some of the core issues that surround our how might we question are things like: How do we get people equal opportunities for success and increase opportunities for social mobility How do we realize everyone’s human right- since the goal of education can be seen as to overcome poverty How can we leverage education to get the most out of our human capital and continue being front-runners in our global economy? How can we protect the promises of democracy when thinking of education as a means to informed citizenship How can we unlock the potential of all students How can we redistribute wealth – maybe by making the tax code more progressive and make sure schools in low income communities get equitable funding How can we make access to education more feasible- and make sure that the quality of that education is maintained? How can we make sure education stays a priority in our national agenda How can we convince tax payers of the benefits of public education   Some questions I would like to pose to the class: What are some organizations or programs you know about that are working to address educational inequity? What do you see as the purpose of education (because that can help us reframe our how might we question)?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  The how might we question that my team is focused on is: How might be create a classroom tool (i.e. program, workshop, book, etc.) that will help address problems of educational inequity while promoting the value of education in society? Since solving educational inequity, and issues of inequity in general, is a huge and complicated task, the idea of framing and reframing the problem is super beneficial. I like the way that the “Simplifying Complexity” video put it: we must step back and acknowledge complexity so that you can hone into a specific problem that might end up being different than what you started with!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Some of the core issues that surround our how might we question are things like:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How do we get people equal opportunities for success and increase opportunities for social mobility
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How do we realize everyone’s human right- since the goal of education can be seen as to overcome poverty
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we leverage education to get the most out of our human capital and continue being front-runners in our global economy?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we protect the promises of democracy when thinking of education as a means to informed citizenship
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we unlock the potential of all students
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we redistribute wealth – maybe by making the tax code more progressive and make sure schools in low income communities get equitable funding
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we make access to education more feasible- and make sure that the quality of that education is maintained?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we make sure education stays a priority in our national agenda
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • How can we convince tax payers of the benefits of public education

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Some questions I would like to pose to the class: What are some organizations or programs you know about that are working to address educational inequity? What do you see as the purpose of education (because that can help us reframe our how might we question)?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  HTML Editor Rich Content Editor

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Collapse Subdiscussion NEIL SHANKAR

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      NEIL SHANKAR

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Mar 15, 2017 Mar 15 at 11:37pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Akemi. The phrase "educational inequality" brings to mind the phrase "democratization of education," which makes me think of Khan Academy, Codecademy, and other MOOCs.  Regarding the purpose of structured higher education... that's a big one. I see the most valuable components as accountability, access to privileged resources (in some cases), and networking.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Akemi. The phrase "educational inequality" brings to mind the phrase "democratization of education," which makes me think of Khan Academy, Codecademy, and other MOOCs. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Regarding the purpose of structured higher education... that's a big one. I see the most valuable components as accountability, access to privileged resources (in some cases), and networking.
