                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion Brytni Johnston

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Brytni Johnston

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:52am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Hi Catalina! Thanks for your response, your project was one of the ones I was most interested in. I'm happy to provide my responses for both of your questions.  First, I do consider class location when signing up for discussion sections (which often have multiple locations) but usually there isn't a lot of choice when it comes to the courses and lectures themselves. If the class is far from where I live or far from a class I have immediately before or after, I will avoid it if possible.  As for least favorite building, I'm torn. I think VLSB is one of the most visually stunning buildings on campus but the lecture halls are all very dark and hot, leading me to fall asleep during class far more than I normally would (people are much more likely to doze off when they are warm and in the dark than if they are cold and well lit). 2040, 2050, and 2060 VLSB all have nearly no natural light and are very warm, making it very uncomfortable to attend lectures there.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Edit

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Hi Catalina!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Thanks for your response, your project was one of the ones I was most interested in. I'm happy to provide my responses for both of your questions. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              First, I do consider class location when signing up for discussion sections (which often have multiple locations) but usually there isn't a lot of choice when it comes to the courses and lectures themselves. If the class is far from where I live or far from a class I have immediately before or after, I will avoid it if possible. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              As for least favorite building, I'm torn. I think VLSB is one of the most visually stunning buildings on campus but the lecture halls are all very dark and hot, leading me to fall asleep during class far more than I normally would (people are much more likely to doze off when they are warm and in the dark than if they are cold and well lit). 2040, 2050, and 2060 VLSB all have nearly no natural light and are very warm, making it very uncomfortable to attend lectures there.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Alix Mcmenamy

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 1:10pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hi Catalina! My least favorite building on campus Dwinelle. It is typically very crowded and the classrooms get pretty hot and musty. I also feel like the lights are too bright which tend to give me headaches. The desks and the chalkboards remind me of an old school style which I don't really care for. The hallways don't have much lighting which seems to just make everyone feel tired. However, I have most of my classes in this building so I don't really have a choice. And, it is in a convenient location because it's near GBC and not too far from where I live.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hi Catalina!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  My least favorite building on campus Dwinelle. It is typically very crowded and the classrooms get pretty hot and musty. I also feel like the lights are too bright which tend to give me headaches. The desks and the chalkboards remind me of an old school style which I don't really care for. The hallways don't have much lighting which seems to just make everyone feel tired. However, I have most of my classes in this building so I don't really have a choice. And, it is in a convenient location because it's near GBC and not too far from where I live.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Aaya Abdelshafy

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Aaya Abdelshafy

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 8:42am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    My team is focusing on a few “how might we?” questions including the following: How might we make clothing more sustainable and affordable? How might we include all of our visions in our finished product? How might we make “wearable art” more accessible? In order to identify the true core elements of our project, we must go out and talk to our intended customer base. However, there are a few interacting elements that stand out right now. We should interact with thrift shop owners, those who enjoy thrift shopping and those who do not prefer to thrift shop, students on a limited budget, artists, environmentalists, and so forth. We essentially want to find out how to appeal to a large customer base while addressing the problems that are currently facing the fashion market and its customers. I still do not fully understand how we are going to address all of these problems. Is it truly possible to make sustainable/inexpensive clothing that is of high quality? Should we forget about the "wearable art" aspect of our project? I am also still very confused about the business side of this. How do we bring our collective visions to the market? Are we even asking the right questions? Perhaps we should not be focusing so much on the business aspects, but rather on the problems and the customer base first. How is your group tackling this—do you already have answers to your questions? I assume that most of my questions will be answered after we conduct some interviews and develop customer journey or empathy maps (Barry and Beckman). I am having some difficulty reframing the questions more. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    My team is focusing on a few “how might we?” questions including the following: How might we make clothing more sustainable and affordable? How might we include all of our visions in our finished product? How might we make “wearable art” more accessible? In order to identify the true core elements of our project, we must go out and talk to our intended customer base. However, there are a few interacting elements that stand out right now. We should interact with thrift shop owners, those who enjoy thrift shopping and those who do not prefer to thrift shop, students on a limited budget, artists, environmentalists, and so forth. We essentially want to find out how to appeal to a large customer base while addressing the problems that are currently facing the fashion market and its customers. I still do not fully understand how we are going to address all of these problems. Is it truly possible to make sustainable/inexpensive clothing that is of high quality? Should we forget about the "wearable art" aspect of our project? I am also still very confused about the business side of this. How do we bring our collective visions to the market? Are we even asking the right questions? Perhaps we should not be focusing so much on the business aspects, but rather on the problems and the customer base first. How is your group tackling this—do you already have answers to your questions? I assume that most of my questions will be answered after we conduct some interviews and develop customer journey or empathy maps (Barry and Beckman). I am having some difficulty reframing the questions more.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Brytni Johnston

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Brytni Johnston

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:47am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Hi Aaya,  Thanks for your response. My group is also struggling with framing and reframing our problem due to feasibility issues. The question about whether or not to take a major pivot in the project is very tough, but from my perspective, the purpose of the weeks of research we currently are doing is to allow us to find these pivot points and settle on what we want to do. I think finding companies that recycle textiles would be a good place to start interviewing. It may not be necessary to start your own textile recycling company if you can work to expand or support an existing one.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Hi Aaya, 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Thanks for your response. My group is also struggling with framing and reframing our problem due to feasibility issues. The question about whether or not to take a major pivot in the project is very tough, but from my perspective, the purpose of the weeks of research we currently are doing is to allow us to find these pivot points and settle on what we want to do. I think finding companies that recycle textiles would be a good place to start interviewing. It may not be necessary to start your own textile recycling company if you can work to expand or support an existing one.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Collapse Subdiscussion SUZI HYUN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          SUZI HYUN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 9:55am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Our team is still in the process of solidifying the HMW question. But these are two main HMW questions we'd like to tackle: 1) how might we provide energy to places in need? 2) how might we motivate a person to exercise? Though these two questions appear unrelated to each other; our initial, imperfect premise was that we might be able to find ways to motivate a person to exercise, then find ways to store and transport kinetic energy (generated when exercising) to places in need of energy/power. But because we are unsure about the plausibility of this premise, we are trying to be flexible in reframing our question.  I am personally more inclined towards focusing on the question of how might we provide energy to places in need. If we happen to only tackle that problem, the core elements of our system would include access to energy, storage for energy, and navigation/transportation of energy.  These are some questions I wish I had answers to: 1) For the 1.3 billion people living in dire need of energy - where and when does the need for energy arise the most? (lighting? cooking? heating?) 2) How could renewable energy be connected to a social cause?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Our team is still in the process of solidifying the HMW question. But these are two main HMW questions we'd like to tackle: 1) how might we provide energy to places in need? 2) how might we motivate a person to exercise? Though these two questions appear unrelated to each other; our initial, imperfect premise was that we might be able to find ways to motivate a person to exercise, then find ways to store and transport kinetic energy (generated when exercising) to places in need of energy/power. But because we are unsure about the plausibility of this premise, we are trying to be flexible in reframing our question. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          I am personally more inclined towards focusing on the question of how might we provide energy to places in need. If we happen to only tackle that problem, the core elements of our system would include access to energy, storage for energy, and navigation/transportation of energy. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          These are some questions I wish I had answers to: 1) For the 1.3 billion people living in dire need of energy - where and when does the need for energy arise the most? (lighting? cooking? heating?) 2) How could renewable energy be connected to a social cause?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Edited by SUZI HYUN on Mar 16 at 11:49am

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion MATT WHITTLE

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              MATT WHITTLE

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 12:18pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Hey Suzi, I find your second super interesting and moving. I am currently in a climate change and policy class and one of the major focuses of the class is thinking of ways to support and implement renewable energy. Not only is this healthy for the environment but and potentially healthy way to bring energy to the majority of the world. Many people do not have access to any energy at all but there is so much kinetic energy not being harvested. I also see a huge market for private investors to cash in on solar/wind farms in under developed nations around the world. But a question on that point is would it still be a social cause if the private investors only about the return they see rather than providing electricity to people less fortunate?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Hey Suzi,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              I find your second super interesting and moving. I am currently in a climate change and policy class and one of the major focuses of the class is thinking of ways to support and implement renewable energy. Not only is this healthy for the environment but and potentially healthy way to bring energy to the majority of the world. Many people do not have access to any energy at all but there is so much kinetic energy not being harvested. I also see a huge market for private investors to cash in on solar/wind farms in under developed nations around the world. But a question on that point is would it still be a social cause if the private investors only about the return they see rather than providing electricity to people less fortunate?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Attach
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Collapse Subdiscussion ELVA CHEN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ELVA CHEN

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:18am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Our “how might we” question is: How might we help Berkeley designers grow and give them a sense of belonging?   At the first glance, the system we are dealing with is the group of designers at UC Berkeley. However, if we zoom in into the problem, the group of people are not all the same: designers include product designers, graphic/visual designers, environment/urban designers, etc. They do not necessarily share the same features and interests and can ask for very different things for their professional and emotional development.   If we zoom out in the system, we see more than just individuals in our problem – the existing organizations and school programs/facilities are all tackling this problem in different ways. Jacobs Hall provide resources and classes to help designers develop their skill-sets; on-campus clubs such as Berkeley Innovation and Innovative Design creates a small community of designers – but a bit exclusively; College of Environmental Design has degree programs, which is possibly the best way to create a community for their designers. When tackling this program, we need to take into account of the existing stakeholders and current solutions to best position ourselves and to re-frame the problem properly.   If you think you have a community that helps you grow academically/professionally as well as provide you with emotional support, can you reflect on this “system” and tell me what are some essential elements in that system to make it a place for you? If you are still looking for such a system, what are some must-have elements in this ideal system? I look forward to your responses!
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Our “how might we” question is: How might we help Berkeley designers grow and give them a sense of belonging?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                At the first glance, the system we are dealing with is the group of designers at UC Berkeley. However, if we zoom in into the problem, the group of people are not all the same: designers include product designers, graphic/visual designers, environment/urban designers, etc. They do not necessarily share the same features and interests and can ask for very different things for their professional and emotional development.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                If we zoom out in the system, we see more than just individuals in our problem – the existing organizations and school programs/facilities are all tackling this problem in different ways. Jacobs Hall provide resources and classes to help designers develop their skill-sets; on-campus clubs such as Berkeley Innovation and Innovative Design creates a small community of designers – but a bit exclusively; College of Environmental Design has degree programs, which is possibly the best way to create a community for their designers. When tackling this program, we need to take into account of the existing stakeholders and current solutions to best position ourselves and to re-frame the problem properly.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                If you think you have a community that helps you grow academically/professionally as well as provide you with emotional support, can you reflect on this “system” and tell me what are some essential elements in that system to make it a place for you? If you are still looking for such a system, what are some must-have elements in this ideal system? I look forward to your responses!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                HTML Editor Rich Content Editor

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Shreya Chaganti

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Shreya Chaganti

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:24am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    The how might we we are working on is how might we use success stories to help people achieve success. The core elements are the students, their dreams, and people who have achieved those dreams. What we were thinking about doing was a video series of interviews with successful people asking them how they got to where they are. Right now we're not sure- what is the best way to fit these pieces together to have the most impact? How do we create something unique that provides value?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    The how might we we are working on is how might we use success stories to help people achieve success. The core elements are the students, their dreams, and people who have achieved those dreams. What we were thinking about doing was a video series of interviews with successful people asking them how they got to where they are. Right now we're not sure- what is the best way to fit these pieces together to have the most impact? How do we create something unique that provides value?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    HTML Editor Rich Content Editor

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Brytni Johnston

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Brytni Johnston

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 10:40am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Our group's HMW question is "How might we navigate energy to places in need?" The core elements of the system are the energy market, social impact, and renewable. We are currently in a bit of flux with the core focus of our project, but we definitely want to work around clean energy and supporting social causes. One possibility we have been discussing is the space of kinetic energy for disadvantaged communities. After researching these technologies it doesn't seem realistic or feasible to work in this space. There are many other renewable energies we could pursue, such as wind or solar. It seems possible that these could be constructed by us fairly easily, but there remains the issue of when/where to apply them. We also have the complex issue of bringing energy to communities not yet on the grid. Not only are these places far from Berkeley and largely physically inaccessible, but there are also potential problems when it comes to power dynamics between communities.  Questions: 1. Is it possible to do projects in other countries without being able to travel to that country, and more important, is it a good idea from the perspective of power dynamics?  2. In the local community, is there a need anywhere for expanded programs when it comes to exercise, and how simple is it to build small power-generating devices? How could renewable energy be connected to a social cause?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Our group's HMW question is "How might we navigate energy to places in need?"

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The core elements of the system are the energy market, social impact, and renewable. We are currently in a bit of flux with the core focus of our project, but we definitely want to work around clean energy and supporting social causes. One possibility we have been discussing is the space of kinetic energy for disadvantaged communities. After researching these technologies it doesn't seem realistic or feasible to work in this space. There are many other renewable energies we could pursue, such as wind or solar. It seems possible that these could be constructed by us fairly easily, but there remains the issue of when/where to apply them.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        We also have the complex issue of bringing energy to communities not yet on the grid. Not only are these places far from Berkeley and largely physically inaccessible, but there are also potential problems when it comes to power dynamics between communities. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Questions:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        1. Is it possible to do projects in other countries without being able to travel to that country, and more important, is it a good idea from the perspective of power dynamics? 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        2. In the local community, is there a need anywhere for expanded programs when it comes to exercise, and how simple is it to build small power-generating devices? How could renewable energy be connected to a social cause?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Collapse Subdiscussion Courtnie Chan

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Courtnie Chan

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 11:25am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The "How Might We?" question my group concluded on is written as follows: How might we teach basic life skills to ensure independence and increase awareness? Students and educators are core elements of the system our question is within. Students are those that lack knowledge in basic life skills and are the subjects that can tell us whether or not certain methods are effective. For example, in what stage of school is it most effective to teach certain life skills? Educators or school administrators are also essential to our HMW system because they have the power to implement different curriculums to force students to learn certain life skills in school. Students can only influence so much; administrators yield the power in school systems. Although this statement makes it seem that one role is more important than the other, both end up working together. So the solution to our HMW must ensure that both work toward improving the well-being of all students!   Questions: 1. What would encourage administrators to allocate funds and energy to a program that teaches college students fundamental skills (that they may or may not learn outside of college)? 2. How can we bring experts in certain fields (i.e. finances, cooking, first aid) to help people learn about the fundamentals of their field without feeling overwhelmed or learning too much?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            The "How Might We?" question my group concluded on is written as follows: How might we teach basic life skills to ensure independence and increase awareness? Students and educators are core elements of the system our question is within. Students are those that lack knowledge in basic life skills and are the subjects that can tell us whether or not certain methods are effective. For example, in what stage of school is it most effective to teach certain life skills? Educators or school administrators are also essential to our HMW system because they have the power to implement different curriculums to force students to learn certain life skills in school. Students can only influence so much; administrators yield the power in school systems. Although this statement makes it seem that one role is more important than the other, both end up working together. So the solution to our HMW must ensure that both work toward improving the well-being of all students!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Questions:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            1. What would encourage administrators to allocate funds and energy to a program that teaches college students fundamental skills (that they may or may not learn outside of college)?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            2. How can we bring experts in certain fields (i.e. finances, cooking, first aid) to help people learn about the fundamentals of their field without feeling overwhelmed or learning too much?

Experts would be able to provide information that is most critical to their work, therefore not overwhelming them.

But I do think bring people to various working environment can be a good way to learn the certain skills as they can experience the skills themselves.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Elmer Pangilinan

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Mar 16, 2017 Mar 16 at 12:07pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Hi Courtnie, I think encouraging administrators to allocate funds to a program outside of regular college classes would be difficult. It does not feel apparent in American education that life skills are an important tenant to be taught. For example, in Japan cooking classes are mandatory for most of their educational career.  Likewise, I believe having a system outside of school where students can follow along by their own time & have easy access to the information provided by the experts would help increase their well-being.
